raw_data.title: Configuration Manager

Prepares change packages for inspection by client personnel. Maintains appropriate configuration schedules, budgets, and design records. Prepares and distributes status accounting reports.

raw_data.title: Security Engineer I

Contributes to the development and implementation of security policies and procedures, helping to ensure compliance with industry standards and regulations. Assists in the configuration and management of security tools such as firewalls, intrusion detection systems (IDS), and antivirus software. Provides security awareness training for employees and end-users.

raw_data.title: Security Engineer III
raw_data.description: Minimum/General Experience: 8+ years of relevant professional experience with a minimum of 5 + years of experience in designing, implementing, and maintaining security measures to protect an organization's computer systems, networks, and data from potential threats and vulnerabilities. 4+ years of experience in a large enterprise environment is preferred. Performs periodic vulnerability scans of networks to identify security vulnerabilities, provides remediation alternatives, and conducts security risk assessments to ensure compliance with corporate security policies and adherence to best practices.

raw_data.title: ServiceNow IT Risk and Compliance Lead
raw_data.description: Minimum/General Experience: 5 - 8 years of relevant professional experience with a minimum of 3+ years of experience managing and overseeing IT risk and compliance activities within an organization using the ServiceNow platform. Possess ServiceNow certificates that provide a fundamental understanding of the ServiceNow platform and modules and that focus on Risk Management, Compliance and IT Governance such as: ServiceNow Certified Implementation Specialist (CIS)– GRC; ServiceNow Certified System Administrator (CSA); Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP); Certified Information Security Manager (CISM); Certified Risk and Information Systems Control (CRISC); Certified in Risk and Information Systems Control (CRISC); Certified Compliance & Ethics Professional (CCEP); Certified Information Privacy Professional (CIPP); ITIL Foundation Certification; COBIT 2019 Foundation.                                                                   Functional Responsibilities: Manages and supervises risk and compliance activities associated with the ServiceNow platform within an organization. Conducts risk assessments to identify potential threats and vulnerabilities linked to the platform. Ensures that the ServiceNow platform complies with industry-specific regulations and compliance standards, such as GDPR, HIPAA, SOX, or ISO 27001, and is responsible for the development and upkeep of IT risk and compliance policies and procedures. Plans and executes security audits, vulnerability assessments, and penetration tests to evaluate the platform's security posture, along with implementing security controls and measures to mitigate potential threats and vulnerabilities. Focuses on incident response planning, security awareness promotion, compliance reporting, security training, and continuous monitoring of the platform's security. Collaborates with various teams to enforce security governance standards, stay updated on regulatory changes, and ensures a secure and compliant ServiceNow environment. Supports the ServiceNow solution through the entire lifecycle of implementation through Operations and Maintenance (O&M).

raw_data.title: ServiceNow OCM Lead
raw_data.description: Minimum/General Experience: 5 - 8 years of relevant professional experience with a minimum of 3+ years of experience overseeing and managing the change management efforts related to the implementation of the ServiceNow platform within an organization.  Possess ServiceNow certificates that provide a fundamental understanding of the ServiceNow platform and modules and that focus on ServiceNow Organizational Change Management (OCM) or other aspects of ServiceNow administration and implementation such as: ServiceNow Certified Implementation Specialist (CIS) with associated micro certifications in Change Management & IT Service Management & Customer Service Management; ServiceNow Certified System Administrator (CSA); ServiceNow Certified Application Developer (CAD);                                                                                  ServiceNow Certified Application Specialist (CAS) with associated micro certification in Change Management. Functional Responsibilities: Orchestrates and oversees the complex process of organizational change associated with the implementation and adoption of the ServiceNow platform within an organization. Develops and executes a comprehensive change management strategy that aligns with the organization's overarching goals. Identifies and engages key stakeholders, including executives and end-users, secures their buy-in and active participation in the transformation process. Assesses the impact of introducing ServiceNow on various business processes and roles, and devises communication plans to disseminate information effectively. Designs training programs, provides ongoing support, and strategizes methods to enhance user adoption. Manages resistance to change, gathers feedback, monitors performance metrics, and collaborates closely with project teams to ensure the seamless integration of change management efforts into the overall project plan. Facilitates a smooth and successful transition. Supports the ServiceNow solution through the entire lifecycle of implementation through Operations and Maintenance (O&M).

raw_data.title: ServiceNow Platform Administrator

Possess ServiceNow certificates that provide a fundamental understanding of the ServiceNow platform and modules and that focus on managing and administering the ServiceNow platform such as: ServiceNow Certified System Administrator (CSA) ; ServiceNow Certified Implementation Specialist (CIS) with associated micro certs in IT Service Management (ITSM), Customer Service Management, Discovery, Asset Management, Field Service Management; ServiceNow Certified Application Developer (CAD).                                                                                                                                                                                                Functional Responsibilities: Configures and maintains the ServiceNow platform. Manages user access and permissions, resolves incidents and problems, and oversees change management processes. Designs and manages the service catalog, implements automation, and maintains data integrity. Focuses on integration, reporting, and security, service level management and knowledge base development. Collaborates with ServiceNow representatives and vendors to stay informed about platform updates, enhancements, and best practices. Manages and responds to security incidents and vulnerabilities to ensure the platform's security. Monitors and optimizes the platform's performance, identifies, and resolves bottlenecks, and implements scalability solutions. Provides support and assistance to end-users, addresses their inquiries, issues, and requests related to the ServiceNow platform. Supports the ServiceNow solution through the entire lifecycle of implementation through Operations and Maintenance (O&M).

raw_data.title: ServiceNow Program Manager
raw_data.description: Minimum/General Experience: 5 - 8 years of relevant professional experience with a minimum of 3+ years of experience in overseeing and managing the successful implementation and operation of ServiceNow within an organization. Possess ServiceNow certificates that provide a fundamental understanding of the ServiceNow platform and modules and that focus on ensuring that ServiceNow is effectively utilized to meet the organization's needs such as: Certified Implementation Specialist (CIS) and associated micro certs to include Project Portfolio Management (PPM); Certified ServiceNow Application Developer (CAD); Certified ServiceNow System Administrator (CSA). As well as relevant industry certifications such as: Project Management Professional (PMP); Certified Scrum Master (CSM) or Certified Scrum Product Owner (CSPO); Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP); Certified Information Security Manager (CISM). Functional Responsibilities: Responsible for planning and executing ServiceNow projects to include defining project scope, objectives, timelines, and budgets using project management methodologies like Agile or Waterfall to ensure that projects are completed on time and within budget. Collaborates closely with vendors and suppliers, monitors timelines, and manages delivery of goods and services on time and within budget. Performs stakeholder communications to include communicating project status, risks, and issues to various stakeholders. Ensures continuous requirements gathering to identify areas where ServiceNow can improve processes, streamline workflows, and deliver greater value. Participates in solution design discussions. Responsible for resource allocation, including assigning tasks to project teams and ensuring that there are adequate resources to meet project deadlines. Establishes and enforce governance policies including use policies, access policies and change management policies. Leads risk management by identifying risks and mitigations, assessing issues, and developing strategies to minimize their impact on ServiceNow project/program success. Participates in post-implementation reviews ensuring the organization derives maximum value from ServiceNow projects and programs. Supports the ServiceNow solution through the entire lifecycle of implementation through Operations and Maintenance (O&M).

raw_data.title: ServiceNow Quality Assurance Lead
raw_data.description: Minimum/General Experience:  5 - 8 years of relevant professional experience with a minimum of 3+ years of experience in ensuring that ServiceNow applications meet the required quality standards, are free from defects, and perform effectively. Possess ServiceNow certificates that provide a fundamental understanding of the ServiceNow platform and modules and that focus on the use of ServiceNow platform for quality assurance purposes such as: ServiceNow Certified System Administrator (CAS); ServiceNow Certified Application Developer (CAD); ServiceNow Certified Implementation Specialist (CIS)and associated micro certs; ServiceNow Certified Performance Analytics Specialist (CPAS); ServiceNow Certified Security Operations Specialist (CSOS): ServiceNow Certified Implementation Engineer (CIE) and associated micro certs.                                                                                Functional Responsibilities:  Develops a comprehensive testing strategy and test plans for ServiceNow applications. This includes defining testing objectives, scope, approach, and resource requirements. Designs test plans and test case scenarios that cover different aspects of ServiceNow applications, including functionality, integration, performance, security, and usability. Oversees the execution of test cases and ensure that they are performed accurately and in line with the test strategy. Works closely with development teams to prioritize and resolve defects and issues uncovered in testing. Implements test automation to streamline testing. Performs regression testing of new features and changes. Conducts performance testing to ensure ServiceNow applications can handle the expected load and perform efficiently. Verifies the security of ServiceNow applications, including access controls, data protection, and compliance with security standards; responsible for maintaining test documentation. Collaborates with end-users and stakeholders to facilitate UAT. Leads and mentors junior members of the QA teams. Communicates testing progress, results, issues, and metrics to project teams and stakeholders. Supports the ServiceNow solution through the entire lifecycle of implementation through Operations and Maintenance (O&M).

Design presentations and reports that are presented to leadership, provide use case scenarios and SOWs for the furtherance of the use of SharePoint across the enterprise, and liaison with stakeholders.

Functional Responsibilities: Participates in test planning, creates test cases, and executes manual and automated tests to identify and report defects. Stays involved in regression testing and performance testing to assess software stability and performance. Actively participates in continuous learning, stays updated with testing methodologies and tools to enhance testing skills and contributes effectively to software testing efforts within the organization.

Specializes in defect management, reporting, and metrics analysis, providing insights that drive process improvements. Mentors junior testers, shares their expertise, and contributes to test process enhancements, integrating testing into DevOps pipelines and exploring specialized testing domains. Ensures software quality within organizations.

Functional Responsibilities: Develops and leads long-term cybersecurity strategy using industry best practices. Designs and oversees implementation of robust security architecture, ensuring protection of critical assets and data. Develops and manages comprehensive security awareness and training programs for all levels of an organization. Leads and coordinates complex incident response efforts, including managing incident response teams and external stakeholders. Establishes and manages threat intelligence programs to proactively identify and respond to emerging threats. Utilizes advanced threat detection tools and techniques to identify and mitigate sophisticated threats. Develops and enforces comprehensive security governance frameworks, ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements. Leads security audits, assessments, and compliance initiatives, ensuring adherence to industry standards and regulations. Develops, reviews, and enforces security policies, standards, and procedures.
